intro: Euphrasia capitulata, commonly known as the yellow eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Euphrasia capitulata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
